This is an Atom formatted XML site feed. It is intended to be viewed in a Newsreader. Alternatively you can view the HTML archives at https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk/cgi-bin/webadmin?A0=ACB-IT.
LISTSERV Web Interface 2.4.1 2015-02-09T12:49:45Z Jonathan Kay 2015-02-09T12:49:34+00:00 2015-02-09T12:49:34+00:00 E-Health Insider :: Ade Memoire on closing the loop https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ACB-IT;889b0d0c.1502 http://www.ehi.co.uk/insight/analysis/1418/ade-memoire-on-closing-the-loop<br><br>Jonathan Webster Craig 2015-01-07T13:34:59+00:00 2015-01-07T13:34:59+00:00 Re: A horrid medical calculator https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ACB-IT;f48d705c.1501 Looks lovely though!<br><br>Cheers<br>Craig<br><br>From: "OConnor John (ROYAL DEVON AND EXETER NHS FOUNDATION TRUST)" <john.oconnor1@NHS.NET<mailto:john.oconnor1@NHS.NET>><br>Reply-To: "OConnor John (ROYAL DEVON AND EXETER NHS FOUNDATION TRUST)" <john.oconnor1@NHS.NET<mailto:john.oconnor1@NHS.NET>><br>Date: Wednesday, 7 January 2015 13:01<br>To: "ACB-IT@JISCMAIL.AC.UK<mailto:ACB-IT@JISCMAIL.AC.UK>" <ACB-IT@JISCMAIL.AC.UK<mailto:ACB-IT@JISCMAIL.AC.UK>><br>Subject: A horrid medical calculator<br><br>---<br>This message was sent from an email address external to NHSmail but gives the appearance of being from an NHSmail (@nhs.net) address. The recipient should verify the sender and content before acting upon information contained within. [...] OConnor John (ROYAL DEVON AND EXETER NHS FOUNDATION TRUST) 2015-01-07T13:01:56+00:00 2015-01-07T13:01:56+00:00 A horrid medical calculator https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ACB-IT;53bd270e.1501 Just out of interest, has anyone found a medical calculator from an authenticated source worse than this one<br>http://www.monoferdosingtool.com/<br><br>Had a very confused reg trying to work out why the simple calculator was suggesting 10mls MONOFER but<br>the complex calculator was suggesting 5mls.<br><br>Cheers<br>John COBBE LORRAINE (RM1) Norfolk and Norwich University Hospital 2015-01-06T12:29:36+00:00 2015-01-06T12:29:36+00:00 Re: Urine metanephrines units https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ACB-IT;947a8d3c.1501 Hi Stuart,<br><br>Below are the two read codes and the associated unit of measure from the latest read code release. S1 use this to try and force you to change your units, in some cases we can comply in others we can't. If it's a going away test and the hospital isn't supplying the result in this unit then (in your shoes) I wouldn't change the result. Instead I ask the GP to raise a helpdesk call with S1, they tell S1 that the units can't be changed and S1 need to make a change to allow them to be [...] JONES Stuart (Pathology) (RF4) BHR Hospitals 2014-12-31T12:24:36+00:00 2014-12-31T12:24:36+00:00 Urine metanephrines units https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ACB-IT;4b61cea5.1412 Can I ask what units labs are reporting with urine Metanephrines? We use nmol/L (via our referral lab) but apparently TPP practices are unable to file these because SystmOne now requires umol/L. Is there a consensus on agreed UoM?<br><br>Stuart<br><br>Barking, Havering & Redbridge University Hospitals NHS Trust: Working to make our hospitals better. [...] Jonathan Kay 2014-11-27T10:02:38+00:00 2014-11-27T10:02:38+00:00 BBC News - Early detection of liver disease by GPs 'non-existent' https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ACB-IT;1a5134cd.1411 http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/health-30209147<br><br>"GPs don't have access to the right technology."<br>"They are using blood tests which simply don't work. It's 19th Century technology for a 21st Century problem."<br><br>Jonathan Jonathan Kay 2014-11-26T16:03:07+00:00 2014-11-26T16:03:07+00:00 Re: [nhshackday] Fellowship opportunities in the Digital Economy - early career researchers highly encouraged to apply (ref: -191511) https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ACB-IT;51f0d112.1411 Thanks, David.<br><br>I’m very sorry: I’ve sent that to the organisers to fix.<br><br>Jonathan<br><br>On 26 Nov 2014, at 15:53, David Miller <david@openhealthcare.org.uk<mailto:david@openhealthcare.org.uk>> wrote:<br><br>The link on that PDF goes to a 404 Not Found.<br><br>Sad faces.<br><br>Otherwise I would have tweeted the link about.<br><br>On 26 November 2014 at 15:51, Jonathan Kay <jonathan.kay@ndcls.ox.ac.uk<mailto:jonathan.kay@ndcls.ox.ac.uk>> wrote:<br>Dear Colleagues,<br><br>The RCUK Digital Economy Theme is actively looking to fund and support fellows working in DE priority areas from October 2015. Further details on these DE priority areas and how to apply are available in the attached flyer. [...] Jonathan Kay 2014-11-26T15:51:30+00:00 2014-11-26T15:51:30+00:00 Fellowship opportunities in the Digital Economy - early career researchers highly encouraged to apply (ref: -191511) https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ACB-IT;1ed0625f.1411 Dear Colleagues,<br><br>The RCUK Digital Economy Theme is actively looking to fund and support fellows working in DE priority areas from October 2015. Further details on these DE priority areas and how to apply are available in the attached flyer.<br><br>Awards can be up to 5 years in duration and applicants should request the resources they need to deliver the DE research of their proposed fellowship. [...] OConnor John (ROYAL DEVON AND EXETER NHS FOUNDATION TRUST) 2014-10-24T13:38:34+01:00 2014-10-24T13:38:34+01:00 Think its been fixed now https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ACB-IT;2680f9d3.1410 From: CCSM HSCIC (HEALTH AND SOCIAL CARE INFORMATION CENTRE)<br>Sent: 24 October 2014 13:17<br>To: OConnor John (ROYAL DEVON AND EXETER NHS FOUNDATION TRUST)<br>Subject: Read codes PBCL - important notice<br><br>[cid:1F65AE94DAED98FB2433@L]<br><br>Read codes PBCL - important notice<br><br>HSCIC would like to apologise for any confusion regarding the implementation of the October release of the Pathology Bounded Code List (PBCL) resulting in the rejection of tests flagged as 'deleted' from reaching certain GP systems. [...] OConnor John (ROYAL DEVON AND EXETER NHS FOUNDATION TRUST) 2014-10-23T09:50:57+01:00 2014-10-23T09:50:57+01:00 Re: Help !! https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ACB-IT;113fbadc.1410 Ignore my last posting.<br>We just got the message below from TRUD<br>Cheers<br>John<br>From: TRUD news [mailto:uknprc@nhs.net]<br>Sent: 22 October 2014 16:26<br>To: Fairall Paula (ROYAL DEVON AND EXETER NHS FOUNDATION TRUST)<br>Subject: PBCL 1.030 - Important update<br><br>Dear Paula Fairall,<br><br>We are aware of significant issues arising in the filing of laboratory results where deprecation of codes in PBCL 1.030 by suppliers (following their timetable) has taken place ahead of labs being permitted to update their report codes to the new standard (i.e. 4/11/14). We have escalated the issue to the owners of the PBCL who have advised [...] OConnor John (ROYAL DEVON AND EXETER NHS FOUNDATION TRUST) 2014-10-23T09:32:55+01:00 2014-10-23T09:32:55+01:00 Help !! https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ACB-IT;6ea33f0f.1410 Chaps<br>We are getting requests from TPP System 1 users to cease sending out Corrected Calcium results under the old READ code of 44IC and to swap to adjusted Calcium 4Q721<br>The April READ "bulletin" states :<br>4Q72. Calcium level Update Apr14: For deletion Oct14. Use serum/plasma/urine codes<br>But they had not given 4Q721 as the new code in the April bulletin. The new code isn't appearing in the October bulletin either. But it is in the Sunquest ICE map on gp-links for you to make the change, so it must have been included in the April codes file that [...] Jonathan Kay 2014-10-17T11:38:26+00:00 2014-10-17T11:38:26+00:00 There\ufffd\ufffd\ufffds only 3 weeks left to apply for the \ufffd\ufffd650k NHS Innovation Challenge Prizes... https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ACB-IT;68b120d7.1410 SUMMARY:<br><br>There’s only 3 weeks left to apply for the \ufffd\ufffd650k NHS Innovation Challenge Prizes which encourages, celebrates and rewards innovations driven by NHS colleagues in England. Please check out http://www.england.nhs.uk/challengeprizes for more information and guidance on how to make a winning application.<br><br>DETAIL<br><br>The \ufffd\ufffd650k NHS Innovation Challenge Prizes encourages, celebrates and rewards innovation driven by frontline NHS colleagues in England. [...] Jonathan Kay 2014-10-10T06:53:49+00:00 2014-10-10T06:53:49+00:00 Rick Jones, EHI Healthcare IT Champion of the Year, 2014 https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ACB-IT;a37f1906.1410 http://www.ehi.co.uk/news/EHI/9681/dean-street-express-wins-ehi-awards-2014<br><br>The Healthcare IT Champion of the Year award, which is decided by EHI readers, went to Dr Rick Jones, the former specialist advisor to NHS England’s National Pathology Programme, and a consultant at Leeds Teaching Hospitals NHS Trust.<br><br>Rick’s wife, son and colleagues received the award to a standing ovation at the awards ceremony last night. [...] Jonathan Kay 2014-09-18T12:31:06+00:00 2014-09-18T12:31:06+00:00 2014 WiFi Survey https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ACB-IT;aa7ebe91.1409 2014 WiFi Survey!<br><br>Please can you support this survey by completing it, tweeting it, and sharing it generally:<br><br>Full URL: http://bawmedical.co.uk/lime/index.php/696915/lang-en<br><br>Shortened URL: http://bit.ly/1sneR2w<br><br>...<br><br>Please complete for your own organisation and pass it it on.<br><br>Thanks<br><br>Jonathan OConnor John (ROYAL DEVON AND EXETER NHS FOUNDATION TRUST) 2014-09-11T10:54:14+01:00 2014-09-11T10:54:14+01:00 FW: https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ACB-IT;87cd3ed1.1409 Hi Gifford<br>I found a UOM conversion error in the document below<br>Pg/ml = Ng/L not ug/L<br>Cheers<br>John<br><br>http://www.rcpath.org/Resources/RCPath/Migrated%20Resources/Documents/P/PBCL%20UOM%20final%2024%20feb%202014%20with%20change%20notes%20(1).pdf OConnor John (ROYAL DEVON AND EXETER NHS FOUNDATION TRUST) 2014-09-10T11:10:04+01:00 2014-09-10T11:10:04+01:00 Bounded list ver 1.029 https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ACB-IT;dc23e492.1409 Chaps<br><br>I am getting grief from TPP System 1 users about not being able to file pro BNP and Calprotectin results since updating our ICE PMIP system with the following 2 changes<br><br>Calprotectin level<br>Update Apr 14: For deletion Oct14, use 47J.. Faecal calprotectin content<br><br>Serum pro-BNP peptide level<br>Update Apr14: For deletion Oct14: Assay is either for BNP (44AX.) or NT-pro BNP (44AV.) [...] Jonathan Kay 2014-09-04T07:53:01+00:00 2014-09-04T07:53:01+00:00 Re: Matching patient records across clinical systems https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ACB-IT;bbbfc323.1409 There used to be some guidance from the NHS Number programme: your PAS team should have this as part of the Spine work.<br><br>In the blood transfusion projects we found that some of the matching rules were too stringent when used with auoidentification. There were too many rejections of valid matches because of minor details in middle names, double-barrelled and hyphenated names. [...] Mark Sleeman 2014-09-04T08:08:32+01:00 2014-09-04T08:08:32+01:00 Matching patient records across clinical systems https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ACB-IT;7fa9fb68.1409 Hi,<br><br>Does anyone have a standard process in their trust for matching patients between clinical systems based on the core demographics which they'd be prepared to share?<br><br>I'm thinking of the situation where you have a patient record on one system and you query another for matching patients. What criteria are used to automatically accept a match? What criteria would lead to the match being put into an exception list for manual consideration? [...] Webster Craig 2014-08-26T07:59:26+00:00 2014-08-26T07:59:26+00:00 Re: Path Catalogue https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ACB-IT;76c610cc.1408 It has <SNOMEDCT Concept_ID="799711000000109"<br>NLMC_RecommendedDescription="Count of cells positive for both CD19 and<br>lambda\ufffd\ufffd/><br><br>This type of thing. of [...] Webster Craig 2014-08-23T18:30:43+00:00 2014-08-23T18:30:43+00:00 Re: Path Catalogue https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ACB-IT;de0e441f.1408 Don't know if this will make it easier to view a summary of the records but Ive taken them XML and transformed it to a web page at http://secret-garden-2763.herokuapp.com<br>The source code of which is at https://github.com/cwebster/nlmc<br>It should be relatively easy to change the render to display other information and add search<br>Cheers<br>Craig OConnor John (ROYAL DEVON AND EXETER NHS FOUNDATION TRUST) 2014-08-20T12:09:51+01:00 2014-08-20T12:09:51+01:00 Path Catalogue https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ACB-IT;93f30215.1408 Chaps<br>Just want to pick your brains<br>I am guessing that the only format the National Path Catalogue is currently in is XML?<br>At least that's the version that can be found below<br>https://isd.hscic.gov.uk/trud3/user/authenticated/group/0/pack/1/subpack/77/releases<br>I am having discussions with our CCG commissioners about the allocation of tests to different path disciplines in order to work out under which tariff they should be charged under. The guidance in the 2013/2014 Payment by results publication as far as path goes is as below<br>The bit in red is relevant<br>Navigating through the XML is a little complex, but then there is ambiguity [...]
